snippet: The detention without charge of a 25-year-old Iranian-British national who fought for women’s rights has shown, many say, the limits of personal expression in Iran.
abstract: Case of Ghoncheh Ghavami, Iranian-British national being detained in Iran for fighting for women's rights, raises anew question of how far limits of personal expression and rights can be stretched in ran of Pres Hassan Rouhani; Ghavami was arrested on June 30 and has been held in prison since; activists believe her British citizenship has something to do with her harsh treatment.
lead_paragraph: The detention without charge of a 25-year-old Iranian-British national who fought for women’s rights has shown, many say, the limits of personal expression in Iran.

headline.main: Iran’s Jailing of Activist Offers Hint of Liberty Under Rouhani
headline.print_headline: Iran Jailing Offers Hint of Liberty Under Rouhani
